physical_appearance:This is a photograph of L. Berkeley\u0027s House in Lahore. There is a building in the middle of the photograph
 located in the middle of a garden with short hedges and a few trees. The front of the building is made of square columns with high pointed-arched spaces in between. There is a road that cuts across the yard to the building. In front of the building
 there is a horse-drawn carriage. There are four people in the photograph. The title is written at the bottom
 below the photograph.

metadata.title_text: Photograph album of views and portraits in the Punjab, Cashmere, Ceylon, Burma, Penang, Singapore, and Java L. Berkeley's House, Lahore
metadata.materials_name: albumen (egg white protein) albumen paper paper (fiber product)
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a photograph of L. Berkeley's House in Lahore. There is a building in the middle of the photograph, located in the middle of a garden with short hedges and a few trees. The front of the building is made of square columns with high pointed-arched spaces in between. There is a road that cuts across the yard to the building. In front of the building, there is a horse-drawn carriage. There are four people in the photograph. The title is written at the bottom, below the photograph.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Photographs Thomson, J. (John), 1837-1921 Lahore (Pakistan) Government buildings Columns Colonization
